alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Washington (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 6:32PM EDT until June 26 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Washington County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Southwestern Allegheny County in southwestern Pennsylvania... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 632 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Canonsburg, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, McMurray, Canonsburg, Gastonville, West Mifflin, Baldwin, Upper St. Clair, Scott Township, Whitehall, South Park Township, Robinson Township, Cecil-Bishop, Jefferson Hills, Brentwood, Dormont, Castle Shannon, Pleasant Hills, and Carnegie. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 40 and 60. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 58 and 67. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
